Parse cloud groups

parse_metar_cld.Rd

Parse cloud groups

parse_metar_cld(x)

Arguments

x

cloud string

Author

M. Saenger, Zimmerberg Risk Analytics GmbH

Examples

x <- c("SCT009 BKN029 OVC045CB", "SCT009CB OVC045", "NSC")
parse_metar_cld(x)

#>                   cld_grp cld_lay cld_hgt_min cld_hgt_max cld_amt_min
#> 1: SCT009 BKN029 OVC045CB       3           9          45         SCT
#> 2:        SCT009CB OVC045       2           9          45         SCT
#> 3:                    NSC       1          NA          NA         NSC
#>    cld_amt_max ceil TCU CB cld_amt_1 cld_amt_2 cld_amt_3 cld_amt_4 cld_amt_5
#> 1:         OVC   29   0  1       SCT       BKN       OVC      <NA>      <NA>
#> 2:         OVC   45   0  1       SCT       OVC      <NA>      <NA>      <NA>
#> 3:         NSC   NA   0  0       NSC      <NA>      <NA>      <NA>      <NA>
#>    cld_hgt_1 cld_hgt_2 cld_hgt_3 cld_hgt_4 cld_hgt_5 cld_type_1 cld_type_2
#> 1:         9        29        45        NA        NA       <NA>       <NA>
#> 2:         9        45        NA        NA        NA         CB       <NA>
#> 3:        NA        NA        NA        NA        NA       <NA>       <NA>
#>    cld_type_3 cld_type_4 cld_type_5
#> 1:         CB       <NA>       <NA>
#> 2:       <NA>       <NA>       <NA>
#> 3:       <NA>       <NA>       <NA>
m <- parse_metar(metar.test$code)

#> Warning: NAs introduced by coercion
#> Warning: NAs introduced by coercion
#> Warning: NAs introduced by coercion
parse_metar_cld(x = m$cld)
